instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2849: What is 820-2849? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message:
Hi everyone, working on this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. Its been driving me mad for the long time and i cant figure it out so decided to ask you guys some help. its been a pain and i know that it might be a dead video but i believe i can still fix it. Right so the problem is that macbooks starts as it should, chimes ok, but theres no backlight or video.i have checked all power rails and all power rails are pretty much ok. GPU vcore and cpuvcore both present. i have noticed that <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> starts with 1.05v with fans spinning but after fans starts to spin faster voltage drops to 0.89v . is it normal or needs to be investigated? Also came accross that <SIGNAL>GFXIMVP_ISNS_IOUT</SIGNAL>=<SIGNAL>SMC_GFX_ISENSE</SIGNAL> only 0.01V. anyway any suggestions where to start? <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_FUSED</SIGNAL> power stops at <TRANSISTOR>Q9806</TRANSISTOR> pin4. 0V pin 1.2.5.6. <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> -0V. 
L9000 - 0V both sides. <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> 0.01V .Changed <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> no change. really desperate for some help or where to start.

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: Has anyone came across <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with the same no video problem where the board turns on and chimes? <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> missing

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: First thing to check would be with an external monitor. To be sure connect a HDD that will boot fully into OSX so an external monitor can be recognized.

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: Hi Dukefawks. Good to hear from you. Yeah checked it already no signal whatsoever . HDD spins, chimes, but no image on external screen.

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: GPU Vcore present on L8920? Any history, this usually does not "just" happen.

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: L8920  pin2 =0.91V, pin1=0.84V, seems to be ok. it has traces of liquid damage but all components and chips looks ok under the magnifier no obvious burns or damage. the thing is that i have came across 3 faulty  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> laptops in some time and all 3 had the same symptoms. So i was really wondering whats the problem with these boards and why they end up like this .

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: These boards are not known for such failures. Does the board actually boot form a HDD? Need to know if it even gets into OSX. Where was the liquid damage?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: i doubt it boots to osx. cd-rom works usb works hard drive spins but keyboard caps lock not coming on when pressed. also cant do pram reset. if lid shut fans still spin as if its in some kind of sleep state. No obvious corrosions but some contacts oxidised . where shall i start? any ideas?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message:
If you cannot do a PRAM reset there may be more to this. It could be an EFI lock and it won't boot from any device besides the one it was locked to.
Was there any corrosion in the LCD connector area? Got 3V on pin 4 6 and 7 of LCD connector? Diode mode on those pins?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: i have been reading a lot of forums and found out people with exactly the same issue. lcd connector pin4=3.3v, pin6=3.23v, pin7=3.23v. diode mode pin 4=280, pin6=570, pin7=570.  I am thinking maybe i should try rewrite bios with clean me region as i mentioned in other forums that was the only thing that worked.  Has anyone got a bios for this model?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: Do you have some donor boards? You can take the BIOS from a 2850 board for testing. Always backup your original file, the original ME has nothing wrong with it and should be merged with a working BIOS.

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message:
ok so i have tried to swap bios but no luck,still the same thing. i have managed to reset pram now but it didnt help either. it starts chimes but no video. all power seems to be there keyboard works. checked lvds ddc mux and <SIGNAL>LVDS_DDC_SEL_IG</SIGNAL> missing 0V. measured <RESISTOR>R9682</RESISTOR>-0V. Other required pulldowns has power but <RESISTOR>R9693</RESISTOR> missing as well. Also checked  <TRANSISTOR>Q9607</TRANSISTOR> and pin2 ALL SYS PWRGD has power, <RESISTOR>R9676</RESISTOR> pin1 has power but pin 2-0V. could you explain how it works? as far as i can understand when all sys pwrgd powers the gate it opens and lets <SIGNAL>GMUX_S3_PD_EN</SIGNAL> open the gate right? but now pin 6 and 5 0V
<RESISTOR>R9678</RESISTOR> has power pin2 but 0V pin1 so <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is 0V somehow. really struggling to understand why as pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R9678</RESISTOR> is <SIGNAL>GMUX_S3_PD_GND</SIGNAL> so should be 0v i guess but now pin2 of <RESISTOR>R9678</RESISTOR>=2.64V, pin1=0V

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: any suggestions duke?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: or anyone else?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: How are you testing with external screen? Was this board messed with already? Any history as these boards do not have video issue like this normally.

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: i have tested the screen on the another laptop it works fine. i have checked on external screen no video as well. originally it was water damaged. had 3 boards and all with the similar symptoms. what can possibly cause this? everything seems to work just <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> missing and i guess thats why theres no  video .

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: I asked what you used to test with an external screen.

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: hi mate, i used my tv. connected with mini display port to  hdmi cable to motherboard

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message: Are you sure this actually works without having OSX booted up? Try with a known good machine if it will display to an external screen without loading OSX.

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A problem no video black screen no backlight
threads.message:
Good Saturday everyone, I have exact same board with seemingly same issue. No internal video nor backlight, boots, chimes, loads into OSX.

External video works fine.
Tried different LCD cables and different LCDs.

<SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> = 0.0V

Did anyone figure this one out yet?
